triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper uses multi-agent reinforcement learning as the core learning mechanism for training robot manipulation policies.

triples.name: Actor-critic algorithm
triples.relevance: The paper employs the Soft Actor-Critic (SAC) algorithm, which is a variant of actor-critic methods for training sub-policies.

triples.name: Robot learning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses robot learning by training a Panda robot to perform grasping and object manipulation tasks.

triples.name: Robotic arm
triples.relevance: The paper uses a Franka Emika Panda robotic arm as the experimental platform for evaluating the multi-stage learning approach.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: The high-level stage selector is trained using supervised learning to coordinate between the six sub-policies.

triples.name: Imitation learning
triples.relevance: The paper compares against imitation-only baselines and mentions learning from demonstrations in the context of traditional approaches.

triples.name: Multi-stage learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel multi-stage learning approach that decomposes grasp-constrained manipulation into independently trained sub-policies.

triples.name: Object manipulation
triples.relevance: The paper addresses grasp-constrained object manipulation as the primary task with obstacles and constraints on object grasping.
